metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6800 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Mozilla developers and community members reported memory safety bugspresent in Firefox 72 and Firefox ESR 68.4. Some of these bugs showedevidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort someof these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. In general, theseflaws cannot be exploited through email in the Thunderbird product becausescripting is disabled when reading mail, but are potentially risks inbrowser or browser-like contexts. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird <68.5, Firefox < 73, and Firefox < ESR68.5.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6800` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 73.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 73.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 73.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '73.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
